chargeHist.descr: Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (7th, 8th or 9th)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael G Mertes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration nor Substance Abuse Program.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

superMiscConds.notes:
Court costs, Blood draw Fee, and Transcript fee paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
Blood draw costs will be forwarded to the City of Waukesha Police and Transcript fee will be forwarded to the DA's office.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Not to be present on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol. (bars, taverns, pubs, liquor stores)

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Michael G Mertes in court, in custody, with attorney Andrew R Rider.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 9 years 9 months (Initial Confinement: 4 years 9 months, Extended Supervision: 5 years) - consecutive to any other sentence
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- 36 months Drivers License Revocation. 
- 36 months Ignition Interlock on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant
- Alcohol Assessment
- Court costs of $268.00 to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision
- Blood Test Reimbursement of $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to City of Waukesha Police Department to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision
- Transcript fee in the amount of $6.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to the DA's office to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision 
- Conditions of Extended Supervision: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling or any other approved activity by agent. No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed. No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e. bars, taverns or liquor stores).   Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
with attached witness list filed by the State.

Defendant Michael G Mertes in court, in custody, via video with attorney Adam J. Schleis.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Schleis moves to withdraw as counsel. Atty. Andrew Rider will be appointed as new counsel. Lab results of blood sample addressed. Defense has no objection to the withdrawal of Atty. Schleis. Court grants the motion for substitution of Attorneys. Case continued as set. Atty. Rider may have an issue with the next jury trial date and to advise the Court if he does.
Motion hearing on May 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
